Transcription for 1268471

Love is a very splendid thing, It's the April rose that only grows in the early spring.
Love is the wager's way of giving, A reason to be living, That holy crown that brings the man of King.
It burns on a high windmill, With the morning mist to lull this place, Then the world should sing.
When your fingers touch my silent heart, Then thought be hard to sing. Yes, true love is a very splendid thing.
